item.title: Make your conditional statements efficient!
item.description: Recently, I was looking at an R function and found a if statement that looks something like this: 1 2 3 if (length(which(names(df) == "entry")) > 0) { # [...] } I guess this is common way of doing it as it matches well with a way of looking at the problem: “if I want to test the presence of a column “entry” in a data frame (df), I can check if there is more at least one name that match “entry”.
